Name: offset
Desc: Gets the position of the first node relative to the document.
Long Desc: Returns an object containing the top and left coordinates of an element relative to the document. Unlike position(), which provides coordinates relative to the offset parent, offset() calculates coordinates from the top-left corner of the document. This method is particularly useful for absolute positioning of elements anywhere in the document, creating tooltips, overlays, or popovers that need to be placed relative to the entire page regardless of the element's position in the DOM tree.
